Subsequently, beginning 20th March 2020, stronger infectious disease control measures for travellers coming from overseas were enforced, where all Koreans and foreigners with residence in Korea arriving from all countries would be subject to self-quarantine for 14 days upon entry. All short-term travellers will also be ordered to self-quarantine with exceptions for some limited special cases [33]. Around the same time, the Korea Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) also started advising all people in the country to observe an “Enhanced Social Distancing Campaign” [34].
